articles.title: Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on September 18 to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					They included Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party and the delegation of the China Institutes of Contemporary International Relations led by its Vice-President Wang Zaibang.
					
					They made bows in boundless reverence for the President who made immortal contributions to global independence. 
					
					They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Asian U-16 Football Championship Preliminaries End
articles.content:
Asian U-16 Football Championship Preliminaries End

					Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Last matches of Group E preliminaries for the 2012 Asian U-16 Football Championship were held at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang on Sunday.
					
					The DPRK beat China 1:0 and Singapore defeated East Timor 8:1.
					
					As a result of the Group E preliminaries, the DPRK and China will go to the finals to be held next year.
					
					Following are the standings of Group E:
						
					
					No. Team      Matches Played   Won   Drawn   Lost   Goals for, Goals against 
						
					
					  1.   DPRK             4                 4          0          0             16-2
					
					  2.   China               4                 3          0          1               8-3
					
					  3. Singapore          4                  1          1          2             10-6
					
					  4.  Malaysia           4                  1          1          4               3-24

articles.title: DPRK Seeks Winning Streak in Asian U-16 Football Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Seeks Winning Streak in Asian U-16 Football Championship

					Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Group E preliminaries for the 2012 Asian U-16 Football Championship, that began at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang on September 8, closed Sunday, with the DPRK and China having the last match.
					
					The two teams are already qualified for the championship with three wins. 
					
					The DPRK boys score a goal three minutes before the end of the extra time, thus placing first in the group.
					
					After the match, senior coach of the DPRK team Paek Kil Song told KCNA that he was satisfied with the results of the match.
					
					"Our team seeks to be second consecutive winner in the championship. To this end, all players and coaches of our team will intensify training in concert to score good results in future matches," he added.
					
					The Chinese team's coach, Xu Lei, said there was not good teamwork as it is not long since the team was organized. It was very difficult that the Chinese team matched with its DPRK rival.
					
					The Chinese team was defeated by the DPRK team but it will prepare well for the championship as it is qualified for the championship, he said. -0-
					
					The DPRK team scored 12 points by winning all the four matches it played. It gained 16 goals.
